intro: Hieracium nutans, commonly known as the nodding hawkweed, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and yellow-orange flower heads that droop downward. The plant produces small, bract-like leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Native to Europe and parts of Asia, it thrives in moist, disturbed soils. It is often found in meadows, along roadsides, and in other open areas.
